title: How to revise a class 11 syllabus while studying in class 12 and aiming for the JEE Advanced - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok.. So, Since you are already familiar with all the topics of 11th I am assuming you know these things.. which of the chapters are your strong points? Which are the chapters or topics you just hate or which are weak points? Which chapters you are ok ok about as in you need to do a little more work on it. On the basis of these three factors you to divide your 11th syllabus in 3 parts.  Strong onesNot so strong onesWeak onesStrong ones will take lesser of your time. You can try revising one chap a day each of physics, chem and maths. Now how you revise these chapters Go through all the formulas of that particular chapterRe-read your notes. If you don't understand anything refer to book or a teacher to understand that particular topicPractice more questions on it so that you know you are crystal clear with all the concepts and application part.For not so strong ones You need to first figure out where you are lacking.  Conceptual partApplication partNot clear with the formulasIf you are lacking in conceptual part You will be needing more number of days to first clear your concepts then moving forward. For Application part You need to practice more number of questions Coming to formulas… you need to remember each one of it. For weak ones It won't be a sort of revising part. It will be more of re-reading it all again part. And it will take most of your time. You need to first read NCERT line by line in order to take reference and understand it. The clear the concept very well and then practice the ample amount of questions. Divide the timetable accordingly  Follow us to read more of our answers or if you want help with your IIT/NEET Prep! Your support will motivate us to write more. ClearExam All the best!! Hope it helps!!

Be on the safer side by completing chemistry first. Then move on to Physics/Maths . In class 11, do all those chapters which you liked very much and it will take not much time to cover them. Read and jot down all the formulas on a sheet. Now take any standard objective book and start solving them in a limited time. This will increase you speed. Another option is that you can opt for a test series like that of Embibe which will definitely help you in advanced 2018. Another strategy is that Full class 12 syllabus + selected topics of class 11 of your choice. Now you must not ignore mathematical reasoning and statistics in maths portion. Don't focus more on boards if you believe that you can easily score 80% by preparing in February month. Keep in mind that 95%+ will do nothing to you but a seat in IIT-JEE will do wonders. Keep aside all the tension . JUST DO IT NOW!!!!!!!
